problem_text:
If G is d-generator group having no non-trivial finite homomorphic images (in particular, if G is an infinite simple d-generator group) for some integer d ⩾ 2, must G × G be a d-generator group?
John S. Wilson
answer: No, it need not (V. N. Obraztsov, Proc. Roy. Soc. Edinburgh, 123 (1993), 839–855).
